newsitem.title: USA: First American Rail reports first revenue.
newsitem.headline: First American Rail reports first revenue.

text.p: First American Railways said Friday that the acquisition of a Colorado railroad helped the company to report its first revenues ahead of schedule.

"Our second quarter results confirm that First American Railways is now a revenue-generating company, an accomplishment we did not anticipate until after our planned launch of the Florida Fun-Train," said president Raymond Monteleone.
The company reported a second quarter loss of $0.09 a share, compared with a loss of $0.07 per share in the 1996 quarter.
But First American reported 1997 second quarter and six-month revenues of $2.6 million.
It said the revenues were generated by its March acquisition of the Durango & Silverton Narrow Gauge Railroad Co, a scenic railroad based in Colorado.
First American is seeking to tap Florida's growing tourist industry with an entertainment train between South and Central Florida.
